TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Specifies the value type.</typeparam>
            <typeparam name="TItem">Specifies the type of SfMultiSelect.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, allows the user to interact with the component. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.</para>
            <para>If enabled,  the `Value` state will be persisted.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Value</term>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the persistence can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows user to add a
            Custom value the value which is not present in the suggestion list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, allows the user to enter a custom value that is not present in the suggestion list. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the virtual scrolling can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The data can be fetched in popup based on ItemsCount, when enabled the EnableVirtualization.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value that represents fetched data in popup based on items count. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>To enable the filtering option in this component.</para>
            <para>Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.</para>
            <para>If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the filtering option can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.</para>
            <para>If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            The default value of EnableChangeOnBlur is true, which means the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the popup visibility state change while selecting the item. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>,</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are
            allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.</para>
            <para>By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.</para>
            <para>This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select
            all the grouped items at once.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the group check box can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the selection order can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are: </para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value>
            The default value of FloatLabelType is Auto, which means the floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when entering a value in it.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Hides the selected item from the list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the selected item should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional HTML attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional input attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Sets limitation to the value selection.</para>
            <para>Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the maximum number of items that can be selected in the list. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            configures visibility mode for component interaction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Specifies the mode that determines the visibility and interactivity of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Whether to automatically open the popup when the control is clicked.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the popup automatically opened while clicking the control. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in MultiSelect. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list. By default, it renders based on its list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list and percentage values has calculated based on input width.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the MultiSelect allows the user to change the value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the MultiSelect component can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectAllText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the selectAllText to be displayed on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables close icon with the each selected item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowDropDownIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the DropDown button on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the drop down button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowSelectAll
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the selectAll option on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the select all option should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Text
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Selects the list item which maps the data `Text` field in the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: UnSelectAllText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the UnSelectAllText to be displayed on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Selects the list item which maps the data `Value` field in the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The current value of the multi select component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the callback to trigger when the value changes.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the template design and assigns it to the selected list item in the input element of the component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the template design and assigns it to the footer container of the popup list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: HeaderTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the template design and assigns it to the header container of the popup list.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the component. By default, it sizes based on its parent.
            container dimension.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>100$</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TabIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the tab order of the DropDownList component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the tab index of MultiSelect DropDown component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnChange
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnKeyUp
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the content of input has changed and gets focus-out.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInput
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers each time when the value of input has changed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input loses the focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: OnFocus
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the input gets focus.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to each list item present in the popup.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: GroupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to the group headers present in the popup list.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NoRecordsTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template design and assigns it to popup list of component, when no data is available on the component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActionFailureTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the template and assigns it to the popup list content of the component, when the data fetch request from the remote server fails.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent

            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem>
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a single value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The MultiSelect component contains a list of predefined values from which a multiple value can be chosen.
            </summary>
            <typeparam name="TValue">Specifies the value type.</typeparam>
            <typeparam name="TItem">Specifies the type of SfMultiSelect.</typeparam>

BoundAttributes.Name: TValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TValue for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: TItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TItem for the Syncfusion.Blazor.DropDowns.SfMultiSelect<TValue, TItem> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the id of the MultiSelect component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a boolean value that indicates whether the component allows the user to interact with it.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, allows the user to interact with the component. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Enable or disable persisting component's state between page reloads.</para>
            <para>If enabled,  the `Value` state will be persisted.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Value</term>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the persistence can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content that has to be passed.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: ValueExpression
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the expression for defining the value of the bound.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowCustomValue
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows user to add a
            Custom value the value which is not present in the suggestion list.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, allows the user to enter a custom value that is not present in the suggestion list. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableVirtualization
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Virtual Scrolling feature is used to display a large amount of data that you require without buffering the entire load of a huge database records in the DropDowns, that is, when scrolling, the datamanager request is sent to fetch some amount of data from the server dynamically.
            To achieve this scenario with DropDowns, set the EnableVirtualization to true.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the virtual scrolling can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemsCount
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The data can be fetched in popup based on ItemsCount, when enabled the EnableVirtualization.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value that represents fetched data in popup based on items count. The default value is <c>5</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowFiltering
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>To enable the filtering option in this component.</para>
            <para>Filter action performs when type in search box and collect the matched item through `Filtering` event.</para>
            <para>If searching character does not match, `NoRecordsTemplate` property value will be shown.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the filtering option can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableChangeOnBlur
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>By default, the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.</para>
            <para>If you want to fires the Change event on every value selection and remove, then disable the EnabledChangeOnBlur property.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            The default value of EnableChangeOnBlur is true, which means the MultiSelect component fires the Change event while focus out the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableCloseOnSelect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Based on the property, when item get select popup visibility state will changed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the popup visibility state change while selecting the item. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the CSS class name that can be appended with the root element of the MultiSelect. One or more custom CSS classes can be added to a MultiSelect.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DelimiterChar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the delimiter character for 'default' and 'delimiter' visibility modes.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>,</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableGroupCheckBox
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies a boolean value that indicates the whether the grouped list items are
            allowed to check by checking the group header in checkbox mode.</para>
            <para>By default, there is no checkbox provided for group headers.</para>
            <para>This property allows you to render checkbox for group headers and to select
            all the grouped items at once.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the group check box can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableSelectionOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Reorder the selected items in popup visibility state.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the selection order can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterBarPlaceholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Accepts the value to be displayed as a watermark text on the filter bar.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FloatLabelType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the floating label behavior of the MultiSelect that the placeholder text floats above the MultiSelect based on the following values.
            <para>Possible values are: </para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>Never</term>
            <description>Never floats the label in the MultiSelect when the placeholder is available.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Always</term>
            <description>The floating label always floats above the MultiSelect.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Auto</term>
            <description>The floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when enters the value in it.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value>
            The default value of FloatLabelType is Auto, which means the floating label floats above the MultiSelect after focusing it or when entering a value in it.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HideSelectedItem
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Hides the selected item from the list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the selected item should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional HTML attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: InputAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional input attributes such as disabled, value, and more to the root element.
            <para>If you configured both the property and equivalent input attribute, then the component considers the property value.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            A dictionary of additional input attributes for the root element of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MaximumSelectionLength
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Sets limitation to the value selection.</para>
            <para>Based on the limitation, list selection will be prevented.</para>
            </summary>
            <value>
            An integer value representing the maximum number of items that can be selected in the list. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            configures visibility mode for component interaction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Specifies the mode that determines the visibility and interactivity of the component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenOnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Whether to automatically open the popup when the control is clicked.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the popup automatically opened while clicking the control. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Placeholder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the text that is shown as a hint or placeholder until the user focuses or enter a value in MultiSelect. The property is depending on the FloatLabelType property.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the height of the popup list. By default, it renders based on its list item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupWidth
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the width of the popup list and percentage values has calculated based on input width.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>100%</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Readonly
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the boolean value whether the MultiSelect allows the user to change the value.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the MultiSelect component can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectAllText
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the selectAllText to be displayed on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowClearButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enables close icon with the each selected item.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the clear button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowDropDownIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the DropDown button on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the drop down button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowSelectAll
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows you to either show or hide the selectAll option on the component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the select all option should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

            <value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

            </summary>
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SortOrder
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Specifies the `SortOrder` to sort the data source.</para>
            <para>The available type of sort orders are.</para>
            <list type="bullet">
            <item>
            <term>None</term>
            <description>The data source is not sorting.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Ascending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with ascending order.</description>
            </item>
            <item>
            <term>Descending</term>
            <description>The data source is sorting with descending order.</description>
            </item>
            </list>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The order of sorting the list items. The default value is <c>SortOrder.None</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: DataSource
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            <para>Gets or sets the list items either through local or remote service and binds it to the component.</para>
            <para>It can be an array of JSON Objects or an instance of `DataManager`.</para>
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Binding data to the popup element. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the external `Query` that execute along with data processing.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            Query value to be used for data fetching. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FilterType
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets which filter type, the component needs to be considered on search action.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The filter type specifed for searching the list items. The default value is <c>FilterType.StartsWith</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreCase
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether case-sensitivity is enabled or disabled when searching for suggestions.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, consider the `case-sensitive` on performing the search to find suggestions. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IgnoreAccent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether diacritic characters or accents are ignored.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, ignores the diacritic characters or accents when filtering. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the z-index value of the component popup element.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            The ZIndex value for the popup element.The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogAnimationSettings
TagHelpers.Documentation:
A class used for configuring the animation properties in the . In the following example, change the animation effect and delay time while opening the dialog.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Delay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the delay in milliseconds before the animation begins.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The animation delay is used for showing or hiding the dialog.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Duration
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the duration in milliseconds that the animation takes to open or close the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" />.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The animation duration for showing or hiding the dialog. The default value is <c>400</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the name of the animation that should be used when opening and closing the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" />.
            The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the dialog:
            1. Fade
            2. FadeZoom
            3. FlipLeftDown
            4. FlipLeftUp
            5. FlipRightDown
            6. FlipRightUp
            7. FlipXDown
            8. FlipXUp
            9. FlipYLeft
            10. FlipYRight
            11. SlideBottom
            12. SlideLeft
            13. SlideRight
            14. SlideTop
            15. Zoom
            16. None.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The animation effect for showing or hiding the dialog.
            </value>        
            <remarks>
            If the Fade animation is enabled, the dialogwill open with the 'FadeIn' effect and close with the 'FadeOut' effect.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton
TagHelpers.Documentation:
A class used for configuring the button properties in the component. In the following code example, a basic DialogButton has been rendered using the tag directive.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private void OnBtnClick() { this.Visibility = false; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, the button is rendered using the property.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content specified within the tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. 
            The string content is also specified using the property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of button element. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right-to-left direction for the button.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right-to-left direction is enabled for the button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the primary style for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the toggle option for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets an event callback that is triggered when the button is clicked. The event is triggered for UI-based clicks only.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The Blazor Dialog is a user interface (UI) component that displays critical information, errors, warnings, and questions to users, as well as confirms decisions and collects input from the users.
            Based on user interactions, the dialog is classified as modal or non-modal (modeless).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets id attribute for the dialog element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnablePersistence
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to persist component's state between page reloads. When set to <c>true</c>, the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height" /> properties values are persisted
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the component's state persistence is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            Component's <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position" />, <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Width" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.Height" /> properties will be stored in browser local storage to persist component's state when page reloads. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the child content of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowDragging
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component can be dragged by the user. 
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dragging is enabled for dialog component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can reposition the dialog by clicking and dragging the header. You can only drag the dialog within the container element.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseOnEscape
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component can be closed on pressing the escape <c>(ESC)</c> key.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog closing by pressing the escap key. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the value that can be displayed in the content section of the component. The content displayed in the dialog component.The default value is string.Empty. @code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string DialogContent { get; set; } = "

Dialog content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the custom classes to customize the component. If we set the css class, then the custom class is applied for dialog. The default value is string.Empty.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableResize
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the user can resize the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog component creates a grip to resize it in a diagonal direction. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            You can't able to resize the dialog below the value specified in the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.MinHeight" /> property.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ResizeHandles
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the resize handles direction in the component that the user can resize. You can set the resize direction for dialog component. The default value is new ResizeDirection[] { ResizeDirection.SouthEast }. To resize the dialog in a specific direction, enable .

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private ResizeDirection[] ResizeHandles { get; set; } protected override void OnInitialized() { ResizeHandles = new ResizeDirection[] { ResizeDirection.NorthEast }; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dialog component. The default value is `false`. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of footer area. The action buttons are enabled by default in the footer. The default value is `string.Empty`. This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the tag will be disabled.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string FoooterTemplate { get; set; } = "

Footer content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Header
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of title area. string.Empty, if dialog will be displayed without the header. The default value is `string.Empty`.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string HeaderTemplate { get; set; } = "

Header content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the height of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the height value, then the dialog will render based on specified height otherwise the default height value `auto` is set.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsModal
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> can be displayed as modal.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the modal dialog is enabled. The default value is `false`. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            <c>Modal</c>: It creates an overlay that prevents interaction with the parent application and the user.
            <c>Modeless</c>: It does not prevent the user from interacting with the parent application.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the min-height of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the min-height value, then the dialog will render based on specified min-height. The default value is string.Empty. The dialog's minimum height can be adjusted using the MinHeight property. The dialog size will be limited to the MinHeight setting if the user attempts to resize it below this threshold.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that represents whether the close icon can be displayed in the dialog's title section.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the close icon in dialog component is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target element in which the should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element. You can use this property to specify the CSS selector.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that represents whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component is visible.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog will be open at initially. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component is visible.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the width of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the width value, then the dialog will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value 100% is set.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ZIndex that determines whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> is displayed in front of or behind another component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The dialog will display in front of other component. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
             Set the ZIndex to the dialog by obtaining all of the ZIndex elements from a page and calculating the maximum ZIndex.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowPrerender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether the component re-render or not when the dialog gets open. true, if dialog component elements are maintained on the DOM when closing and opening it; otherwise, false.The default value is false. Disabling this property, the Dialog component DOM element will be destroyed when closing and re-rendered the dialog DOM element while opening it. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown when opening it and remain hidden while closing it when enabled.

BoundAttributes.Name: ResizeHandles
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the resize handles direction in the component that the user can resize. You can set the resize direction for dialog component. The default value is new ResizeDirection[] { ResizeDirection.SouthEast }. To resize the dialog in a specific direction, enable .

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private ResizeDirection[] ResizeHandles { get; set; } protected override void OnInitialized() { ResizeHandles = new ResizeDirection[] { ResizeDirection.NorthEast }; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the right to left direction is enabled for <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for dialog component. The default value is `false`. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: FooterTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of footer area. The action buttons are enabled by default in the footer. The default value is `string.Empty`. This is an optional property and can be used only when the footer is occupied with information or custom components. If the footer template is configured to the dialog, the tag will be disabled.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string FoooterTemplate { get; set; } = "

Footer content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Header
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets template as string, that defines custom appearance of title area. string.Empty, if dialog will be displayed without the header. The default value is `string.Empty`.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; private string HeaderTemplate { get; set; } = "

Header content

"; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the height of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the height value, then the dialog will render based on specified height otherwise the default height value `auto` is set.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: HtmlAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional Html attributes such as id, title, etc., to the dialog element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsModal
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> can be displayed as modal.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the modal dialog is enabled. The default value is `false`. 
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            <c>Modal</c>: It creates an overlay that prevents interaction with the parent application and the user.
            <c>Modeless</c>: It does not prevent the user from interacting with the parent application.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: MinHeight
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the min-height of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the min-height value, then the dialog will render based on specified min-height. The default value is string.Empty. The dialog's minimum height can be adjusted using the MinHeight property. The dialog size will be limited to the MinHeight setting if the user attempts to resize it below this threshold.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that represents whether the close icon can be displayed in the dialog's title section.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the close icon in dialog component is enabled. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the target element in which the should be displayed. The default value is null, which refers to the `Document.body` element. You can use this property to specify the CSS selector.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that represents whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component is visible.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the dialog will be open at initially. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets an event callback that is raised when the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component is visible.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets the width of the in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels. If we set the width value, then the dialog will render based on specified width otherwise the default width value 100% is set.

Dialog content

@code { private bool Visibility { get; set; } = true; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ZIndex
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the ZIndex that determines whether the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> is displayed in front of or behind another component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            The dialog will display in front of other component. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>
            <remarks>
             Set the ZIndex to the dialog by obtaining all of the ZIndex elements from a page and calculating the maximum ZIndex.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: AllowPrerender
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets whether the component re-render or not when the dialog gets open. true, if dialog component elements are maintained on the DOM when closing and opening it; otherwise, false.The default value is false. Disabling this property, the Dialog component DOM element will be destroyed when closing and re-rendered the dialog DOM element while opening it. Otherwise, the dialog will be shown when opening it and remain hidden while closing it when enabled.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog.ChildContent
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the child content of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialog" /> component.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogProvider
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            DialogProvider is a target element where the built-in dialogs are shown using <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.ConfirmAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" />,
            <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.AlertAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" /> and <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogService.PromptAsync(System.String,System.String,Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.DialogOptions)" /> 
            methods that are appended to this element. 
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            It is recommended to add this component in `MainLayout.razor` to show utility dialogs from anywhere in the application.
            If you add this to any particular page, the utility dialogs can then be displayed only for that page.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfDialogProvider
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            The SfTooltip component displays a pop-up containing information or a message when you hover, click, focus, or touch an element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Closed` will be fired when the Tooltip component gets closed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opened
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Opened` will be fired after the Tooltip component gets opened.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClose
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnClose` will be fired before the Tooltip hides from the screen.
            The Tooltip close can be prevented by setting the cancel argument value to true.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnCollision` will be fired for every collision fit calculation.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnOpen
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnOpen` will be fired before the Tooltip is displayed over the target element.
            When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip display can be prevented.
            This event is mainly used to refresh the Tooltip positions dynamically or to set customized styles in it and so on.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnRender
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `OnRender` will be fired before the Tooltip and its contents will be added to the DOM.
            When one of its arguments `cancel` is set to true, the Tooltip can be prevented from rendering on the page.
            This event is mainly used to customize the Tooltip before it shows up on the screen.
            For example, to load the AJAX content or to set new animation effects on the Tooltip, this event can be opted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Created
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Created` will be fired after the Tooltip component is created.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Destroyed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The event `Destroyed` will be fired when the Tooltip component is destroyed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the content which has to be passed.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<exclude />
            <summary>
            Defines the Id of the Tooltip component.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Animation
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the animation of the Tooltip while opening and closing.
            The animation property also allows you to set delay, duration, and various other effects of your choice.
            You can set the same or different animation options to the Tooltip when it is in the open or close state.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To close the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the double value. The default value is <c>0</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To display the content of the Tooltip which can be a string element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To customize the Tooltip which accepts the custom CSS class names that define specific
            user-defined styles and themes to be applied to the Tooltip element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To enable or disable the rendering component in the right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: WindowCollision
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to set the collision target element as page viewport (window) or Tooltip element, when using the target.
            If this property is enabled, tooltip will perform the collision calculation between the target elements.
            and viewport(window) instead of Tooltip element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the window collision can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To set the height of the Tooltip component which accepts the string values.
            When the Tooltip content gets overflowed due to the height value, then the scroll mode will be enabled.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>auto</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsSticky
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To display the Tooltip in an open state until it is closed manually.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the tooltip will be displayed in an open state until it is closed manually. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MouseTrail
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It allows the Tooltip to follow the mouse pointer moves over the specified target element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the tooltip shows when the mouse pointer moves over the specific target. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetX
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in X-axis.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the double value that representing the space between target and tooltip element in X-axis.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OffsetY
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It sets the space between the target and Tooltip element in Y-axis.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the double value that representing the space between target and tooltip element in Y-axis.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpenDelay
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To open the Tooltip after a specified delay in millisecond.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the double value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpensOn
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To determine the type of open mode to display the Tooltip content.
            The available open modes are Auto, Hover, Click, Focus, and Custom.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>Auto</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To set the position of the Tooltip element with respect to the Target element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A value of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.SfTooltip.Position" /> enumeration that specifies the position of tooltip element. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.Position.TopCenter" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowTipPointer
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To show or hide the tip pointer of the Tooltip.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the tip pointer should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To denote the target selector where the Tooltip needs to be displayed.
            The target element is considered as the parent container.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Container
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to set the container element in which the Tooltips pop-up will be appended.
            It's default value is `body`, in which the Tooltips pop-up will be appended.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>body</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: TipPointerPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            It is used to customize the position of the tip pointer on the tooltip. The available options are Auto, Start, Middle, and End.
            When set to auto, the tip pointer gets auto adjusted within the space of the target's length and does not point outside.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A value of the <see crerf="TipPointerPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of tip pointer. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Popups.TipPointerPosition.Auto" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            To set the width of the Tooltip component which accepts a string value.
            When set to auto, the Tooltip width gets auto adjusted to display its content within the viewable screen.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>
