BoundAttributes.Name: ContentAlignment
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the alignment of message content. The available content alignments are Left, Center and Right.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.HorizontalAlign" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.HorizontalAlign.Left" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the CSS class or multiple classes separated by space that can be appended with the root element of the Message component to customize a message. The default value is String.Empty. The below code example shows border customization of the Message component. Conference Room no 01 / Building 135 10:00 AM - 10:30 AM ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Severity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the severity of the message, which is used to define the appearance (icons and colors) of the message. The available severity messages are <c>Normal</c>, <c>Info</c>, <c>Success</c>, <c>Warning</c> and <c>Error</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageSeverity" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageSeverity.Normal" />
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show or hide the close icon in the Message component. The end user can click the close icon to hide the message. The <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Closed" /> event triggered when message closed.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the close icon for the Message component is visible at the top right corner of the Message component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowIcon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets whether to show or hide the severity icon in the Message component. When set to true, the severity icon is displayed at the left edge of the Message component.
            This icon will be distinctive based on the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfMessage.Severity" /> property.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c> hides the severity icon in the Message component. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Variant
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the variant from predefined appearance variants to display the content of the Message component. The available variants are <c>Text</c>, <c>Outlined</c> and <c>Filled</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageVariant" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.MessageVariant.Text" />
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the visibility of the Message component. The Message component will be hidden when set to <c>false</c>.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>false</c>, hides the Message component. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: VisibleChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a callback for the bound Visible property value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closed
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Triggers when the Message component is closed (hided) successfully.
            </summary>

In other terms, it simulates the layout of page content while loading the actual content. The `Width` property will be prioritize and used as dimension for Circle and Square . Skeleton with default text shape. ]]> Skeleton with rectangle . ]]> Skeleton with fade effect . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a value that defines the height of the Skeleton. Accept the CSS units as string value. The default value is null. Not required to define this property when is `Circle` and `Square`. Skeleton with `10px` height applied for . ]]>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the visibility state of the Skeleton. true, if the Skeleton is in visible state; otherwise, false. The default value is true. Skeleton rendered with hidden state. ]]>

            </remarks>

<summary>
            Provides data to configure the Toast button properties.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnClick
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the click event binding of action buttons created within Toast.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the text `Content` of the Button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space in the Button element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a value that indicates whether the Button is `Disabled`.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in the right to left (RTL) direction.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines the class/multiple classes separated by a space for the Button that is used to include an icon.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Positions the icon before or after the text content in the Button.
            The possible values are: Left: The icon will be positioned to the left of the text content.
            Right: The icon will be positioned to the right of the text content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Allows the appearance of the Button to be enhanced and visually appealing when set to `true`.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Makes the Button toggle, when set to `true`.
            When you click it, the state changes from normal to active.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the type of the button.
            Possible values are Button, Submit, and Reset.
            </summary>

            Specifies the animation timing function.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the toast.
            If the user sets Fade animation, the toast will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect.
            The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the toast:
            1. Fade
            2. FadeZoom
            3. FlipLeftDown
            4. FlipLeftUp
            5. FlipRightDown
            6. FlipRightUp
            7. FlipXDown
            8. FlipXUp
            9. FlipYLeft
            10. FlipYRight
            11. SlideBottom
            12. SlideLeft
            13. SlideRight
            14. SlideTop
            15. Zoom
            16. None.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Effect
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the animation name that should be applied on while opening and closing the toast.
            If the user sets Fade animation, the toast will open with the `FadeIn` effect and close with the `FadeOut` effect.
            The following are the list of animation effects available to configure to the toast:
            1. Fade
            2. FadeZoom
            3. FlipLeftDown
            4. FlipLeftUp
            5. FlipRightDown
            6. FlipRightUp
            7. FlipXDown
            8. FlipXUp
            9. FlipYLeft
            10. FlipYRight
            11. SlideBottom
            12. SlideLeft
            13. SlideRight
            14. SlideTop
            15. Zoom
            16. None.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Notifications.SfToast
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Toast is a small, nonblocking notification pop-up and it is shown to users with readable message content
            at the bottom of the screen or at a specific target and disappears automatically after a few seconds (time-out)
            with different animation effects.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content to be displayed on the Toast.
            Accepts selectors, string values and HTML elements.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines single/multiple classes (separated by space) to be used for customization of Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of Toast component.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled for the component. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ExtendedTimeout
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Toast display time duration after interacting with the Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value. The default value is <c>1000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Height
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the height of the Toast in pixels/number/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>auto</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Icon
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Defines CSS classes to specify an icon for the Toast which is to be displayed at top left corner of the Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: NewestOnTop
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the newly created Toast message display order while multiple toast's are added to page one after another.
            By default, newly added Toast will be added after old Toast's.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, the new toast will be added after old toast's. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ProgressDirection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             Specifies the direction for the Toast progressBar.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowCloseButton
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show the close button in Toast message to close the Toast.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the close button should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ShowProgressBar
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies whether to show the progress bar to denote the Toast message display timeout.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the progress bar should be shown. Otherwise, <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the target container where the Toast to be displayed.
            Based on the target, the positions such as `Left`, `Top` will be applied to the Toast.
            The default value is null, which refers the `document.body` element.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ContentTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the HTML element/element ID as a string that can be displayed as a Toast content.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Timeout
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the Toast display time duration on the page in milliseconds.
            - Once the time expires, Toast message will be removed.
            - Setting 0 as a time out value displays the Toast on the page until the user closes it manually.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts an integer value. The default value is <c>5000</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Title
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the title to be displayed on the Toast.
            Works only with string values.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Width
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the width of the Toast in pixels/numbers/percentage. Number value is considered as pixels.
            In mobile devices, default width is considered as `100%`.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the string value. The default value is <c>300px</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ID
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the unique identifier.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Sets the content of the Toast.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Renders a form element that cascades an <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm.EditContext" /> to descendants.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdditionalAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will be applied to the created <c>form</c> element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: EditContext
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Supplies the edit context explicitly. If using this parameter, do not
            also supply <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm.Model" />, since the model value will be taken
            from the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditContext.Model" /> property.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Model
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the top-level model object for the form. An edit context will
            be constructed for this model. If using this parameter, do not also supply
            a value for <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm.EditContext" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the content to be rendered inside this <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
             A callback that will be invoked when the form is submitted.
            
             If using this parameter, you are responsible for triggering any validation
             manually, e.g., by calling <see cref="M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditContext.Validate" />.
             </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnValidSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A callback that will be invoked when the form is submitted and the
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm.EditContext" /> is determined to be valid.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: OnInvalidSubmit
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A callback that will be invoked when the form is submitted and the
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Forms.EditForm.EditContext" /> is determined to be invalid.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Context
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the parameter name for all child content expressions.

            An input component for editing <see cref="T:System.Boolean" /> values.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: AdditionalAttributes
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a collection of additional attributes that will be applied to the created element.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: Value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value of the input. This should be used with two-way binding.

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery
TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor Media Query component allows developers to create responsive layouts. The component tracks changes in the browser size and notifies when the browser size matches the specified media query. The class is used to store information about each media query breakpoint, including the Breakpoint name and the MediaQuery itself. The property returns the Breakpoint of the MediaBreakpoint in the MediaBreakpoints collection that matches the current browser size. This allows developers to easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types. Loading... } else { @if(activeBreakpoint == "Small") { } else { } } @code { private string activeBreakpoint; } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActiveBreakpoint
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> in <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> collection that matches with the current browser size.
            Based on the <c>ActiveBreakpoint</c>, developers can easily create responsive layouts that adapt to different screen sizes and device types.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A string value that represents the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> in <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> collection that matches with the browser size.
            The default value is <c>null</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: MediaBreakpoints
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.ActiveBreakpoint" /> is set when a <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" /> matches with the current browser size from this collection.
            </summary>
            <value>
            A collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.Breakpoint" /> and <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint.MediaQuery" />.
            The defaul value is empty collection.
            </value>
            <remarks>
            If <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.MediaBreakpoints" /> is not specified, <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery" /> will use built-in collection of <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.MediaBreakpoint" /> that contains <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Small" />, <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Medium" /> and <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.Large" /> media queries.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ActiveBreakpointChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the event that is triggered when the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.SfMediaQuery.ActiveBreakpoint" /> is changed.
            </summary>

            An event call back function.
            </value>
            <exclude />

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton
TagHelpers.Documentation: Button is a graphical user interface that helps to triggers an event on its click action. It can contain a text, an icon, svg or both. Button content is either by specifying property or by specifying content within tag directive. In the below code example, a basic button is initialized with property. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of Button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the primary style for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the toggle option for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets a a value that indicates the collection of additional attributes that will applied to the button container element. BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

            The SfChip component displays a list of chip each of which contains a block of essential information that triggers an event on click action.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial Class SfChip.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Specifies the Partial class SfChip.
            </summary>
            <summary>
            Partial Class SfChip.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the ChildContent.
            </summary>
            <exclude />

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies the custom classes to be added to the chip element used to customize the chip component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of component. The default value is empty.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Chips
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            This chips property helps to render chipitem component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the list of chip items. Each chip item should contain a text value. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableDelete
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            This enableDelete property helps to enable delete functionality.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the chip component can be deleted. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Enable or disable rendering component in right to left direction.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction can be enabled for the component. The default value is <c>false</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            This enabled property helps to enable/disable chipitem component.
            </summary>
            <value>
            <c>true</c>, If the item can be enabled. Otherwise, <c>false</c>. The default value is <c>true</c>.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedChips
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            This selectedChips property helps to select chip items.
            </summary>
            <value>
            Accepts the list of string (chip's text) to select items in chips. The default value is an empty array.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: SelectedChipsChanged
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the callback to trigger when the selected chips changes. You can get the updated SelectedChips value. In the below code example, the SelectedChips value can be obtained from the SelectedChipsChanged event. @code { private void SelectedChipsChanged(string[] args) { string[] selectedChipItem = args; } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Selection
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            This selection property enables chip selection type.
            </summary>
            <value>
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SelectionType" /> enumeration that specifies the selection of chip items in selection mode. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SelectionType.None" />.
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            You can add the additional html attributes such as title, native events etc., to the wrapper element.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Documentation: The Blazor FAB Component (Floating Action Button) is an extension of that appears in front of all the contents of the page and performs the primary action. A simple FAB with text content. ]]> FAB with icon. ]]> FAB with icon and text. ]]> FAB with info button style. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsPrimary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to apply primary style for FAB. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the primary style is applied for FAB component. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the selector that points to an element in which the FAB will be positioned. The default value is null where FAB is positioned based on viewport of browser. The target element must have relative position, else FAB will get positioned based on the closest element which has relative position. Simple FAB with target. ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Visible
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the FAB is visible or hidden. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the FAB is visible. The default value is <c>true</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that indicates the position of the FAB relative to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" />. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of FAB. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition.BottomRight" />.
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            To refresh the position of FAB on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" /> resized, use <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.RefreshPositionAsync" /> method. 
            The position will be refreshed automatically when browser resized.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: ChildContent
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the Button including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, button is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the content of Button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            Set child content within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton" /> tag directive, to render as HTML content. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to customize the appearance of button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: EnableRtl
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the right to left direction for button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the right to left direction is enabled for button. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the CSS class string to include an icon or image for the button.  
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IconPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display icons in the button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfButton.IconPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.IconPosition.Left" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Left</c>, the icon will be placed left to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Right</c>, the icon will be placed right to the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Top</c>, the icon will be placed above the content of the button. 
            If the <c>IconPosition</c> is <c>Bottom</c>, the icon will be placed below the content of the button. 
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsToggle
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the toggle option for button component. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the toggle option is enabled for button component. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

Additional attributes can be added by specifying as inline attributes or by specifying @attributes directive. TagHelpers.Documentation: RadioButton is a graphical user interface element that allows you to select one option from the choices. It has checked and unchecked states. In the below code example, a basic radiobutton is initialized with Checked property. ]]> The type of value associated with the RadioButton.

BoundAttributes.Name: TChecked
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Specifies the type of the type parameter TChecked for the Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfRadioButton<TChecked> component.

BoundAttributes.Name: Label
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>

            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: LabelPosition
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates how to display label in the radio button. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfRadioButton`1.LabelPosition" /> enumeration. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.LabelPosition.Before" /> 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the <c>LabelPosition</c> is <c>Before</c>, the label will be placed to the left side of the Radio Button. 
            If the <c>LabelPosition</c> is <c>After</c>, the icon will be placed to the right side of the Radio Button. 
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial
TagHelpers.Documentation:
The Blazor SpeedDial component that appears in front of all the contents of the page and displays list of action buttons on click which is an extended version of FAB. The button of speed dial is positioned in relative to a view port of browser or . It can display a menu of related actions or a custom content . A simple SpeedDial with action items. ]]> A SpeedDial with popup template.

Feedback Form

Name

Leave Your Comments
]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: CloseIconCss
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets one or more CSS classes to include an icon or image to denote the speed dial is opened and displaying menu items.
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to include an icon or image for the button. The default value is String.Empty.
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            If the `CloseIconCss` is <c>String.Empty</c>, then the <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.OpenIconCss" /> is used when SpeedDial is open as well.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Content
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the content for the button of SpeedDial. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a string value. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: CssClass
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets one or more CSS classes to customize the appearance of SpeedDial. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            Accepts a CSS class string separated by space to customize the appearance of button. The default value is <c>String.Empty</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Direction
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates the speed dial action items (<see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SpeedDialItems" />) display direction when <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.Mode" /> is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SpeedDialMode.Linear" />. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.LinearDirection" /> enumeration that specifies the direction of speed dial items in linear mode. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.LinearDirection.Auto" />
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Disabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to enable or disable the SpeedDial. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the button component is disabled. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: Mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates the display mode (linear and radial mode) of speed dial action items. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SpeedDialMode" /> enumeration that specifies how the speed dial items are displayed. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SpeedDialMode.Linear" />
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: IsModal
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value that indicates whether the speeddial popup can be displayed as modal or modal less.
            </summary>
            <value> 
            <c>true</c>, if the Speed dial creates an overlay that disables interaction with other elements other than speed dial items. 
            If user clicks anywhere other than speed dial items then popup will get closed.
            The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: ItemTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template content for the . The template content is defined as a child content of ItemTemplate tag directive The template content. The default value is null. The `ItemTemplate` used to define custom template for speed dial item. Use the templates context parameter to access properties. SpeedDial with item template.
@context.Text
]]>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: OpensOnHover
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to open the popup when the button of SpeedDial is hovered. By default, SpeedDial opens popup on click action.
            </summary>

            <c>true</c>, if the SpeedDial opens popup on mouse hover action. The default value is <c>false</c>. 
            </value>

            </value>

BoundAttributes.Name: PopupTemplate
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
Gets or sets a template content for popup of SpeedDial. The template content is defined as a child content of PopupTemplate tag directive The template content. The default value is null. SpeedDial with popup template.

Leave Your Comments

BoundAttributes.Name: Position
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets the value that indicates the position of the button of Speed Dial relative to <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfFab.Target" />. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            One of the <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition" /> enumeration that specifies the position of SpeedDial. The default value is <see cref="F:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.FabPosition.BottomRight" />.
            </value> 
            <remarks>
            To refresh the position of button of speed dial on <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.Target" /> resized, use <see cref="M:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.RefreshPositionAsync" /> method. 
            The position will be refreshed automatically when browser resized.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Target
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets the selector that points to the element in which the button of SpeedDial will be positioned. The default value is null where button is positioned based on viewport of browser. The target element must have relative position, else Button will get positioned based on the closest element which has relative position. Simple SpeedDial with target. ]]>

            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value>

            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: Closing
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the speed dial popup is closed. is a canceable event. To cancel the closing action of SpeedDial Popup, set the property as true. SpeedDial with `Closing` event. @code { private closing(SpeedDialBeforeOpenCloseEventArgs args){ args.Cancel = false; //Set as true to prevent closing of SpeedDial popup. } } ]]>

BoundAttributes.Name: Opening
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Gets or sets an event callback that is raised before the speed dial popup is opened. is a canceable event. To cancel the opening action of SpeedDial Popup , set the property as true. SpeedDial with Opening event. @code { private opening(SpeedDialBeforeOpenCloseEventArgs args){ args.Cancel = false; //Set as true to prevent opening of SpeedDial popup. } } ]]>

TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary> 
            Gets or sets a value that indicates the child content for the SpeedDial including HTML element. If the child content is not specified, SpeedDial is rendered using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.Content" /> property. 
            </summary> 
            <value> 
            The template content. The default value is <c>null</c>. 
            </value> 
            <remarks> 
            The child content which is specified within <see cref="T:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial" /> tag directive is either a string or HTML Element. The string content is also specified using <see cref="P:Syncfusion.Blazor.Buttons.SfSpeedDial.Content" /> property. 
            </remarks> 
            <exclude />

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Razor.TagHelpers.UrlResolutionTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting elements containing attributes with URL expected values.
            </summary>
            <remarks>Resolves URLs starting with '~/' (relative to the application's 'webroot' setting) that are not
            targeted by other <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" />s. Runs prior to other <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" />s to ensure
            application-relative URLs are resolved.</remarks>

<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagHelper" /> implementation targeting <cache> elements.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: priority
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="T:Microsoft.Extensions.Caching.Memory.CacheItemPriority" /> policy for the cache entry.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a <see cref="T:System.String" /> to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-header
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of HTTP request headers to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-query
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of query parameters to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-route
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of route data parameters to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-cookie
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a comma-delimited set of cookie names to vary the cached result by.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-user
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that determines if the cached result is to be varied by the Identity for the logged in
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpContext.User" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: vary-by-culture
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets a value that determines if the cached result is to be varied by request culture.
            <para>
            Setting this to <c>true</c> would result in the result to be varied by <see cref="P:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture" />
            and <see cref="P:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture" />.
            </para>
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: expires-on
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the exact <see cref="T:System.DateTimeOffset" /> the cache entry should be evicted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: expires-after
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the duration, from the time the cache entry was added, when it should be evicted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: expires-sliding
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the duration from last access that the cache entry should be evicted.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: enabled
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the value which determines if the tag helper is enabled or not.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <environment> elements that conditionally renders
            content based on the current value of <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            If the environment is not listed in the specified <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Names" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Include" />,
            or if it is in <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Exclude" />, the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: names
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of environment names in which the content should be rendered.
            If the current environment is also in the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Exclude" /> list, the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The specified environment names are compared case insensitively to the current value of
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of environment names in which the content should be rendered.
            If the current environment is also in the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.EnvironmentTagHelper.Exclude" /> list, the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The specified environment names are compared case insensitively to the current value of
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of environment names in which the content will not be rendered.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The specified environment names are compared case insensitively to the current value of
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.IHostingEnvironment.EnvironmentName" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Documentation:

            </summary>

            </remarks>

            </summary>

            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <input> elements with an <c>asp-for</c> attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-format
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The format string (see https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/txafckwd.aspx) used to format the
            <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.For" /> result. Sets the generated "value" attribute to that formatted string.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Not used if the provided (see <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.InputTypeName" />) or calculated "type" attribute value is
            <c>checkbox</c>, <c>password</c>, or <c>radio</c>. That is, <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.Format" /> is used when calling
            <see cref="M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.IHtmlGenerator.GenerateTextBox(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ViewContext,Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExplorer,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Object)" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: type
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The type of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine the <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.IHtmlGenerator" />
            helper to call and the default <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.Format" /> value. A default <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.Format" /> is not calculated
            if the provided (see <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.InputTypeName" />) or calculated "type" attribute value is <c>checkbox</c>,
            <c>hidden</c>, <c>password</c>, or <c>radio</c>.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine whether <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.For" /> is
            valid with an empty <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExpression.Name" />.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The value of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine the generated "checked" attribute
            if <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.InputTagHelper.InputTypeName" /> is "radio". Must not be <c>null</c> in that case.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LabelTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <label> elements with an <c>asp-for</c> attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <link> elements that supports fallback href paths.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The tag helper won't process for cases with just the 'href' attribute.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: href
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Address of the linked resource.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-href-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to load.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-href-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to exclude from loading.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.HrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-href
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The URL of a CSS stylesheet to fallback to in the case the primary one fails.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-suppress-fallback-integrity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Boolean value that determines if an integrity hash will be compared with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-append-version
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Value indicating if file version should be appended to the href urls.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            If <c>true</c> then a query string "v" with the encoded content of the file is added.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-href-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to fallback to in the case the primary
            one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-href-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of CSS stylesheets to exclude from the fallback list, in
            the case the primary one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test-class
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The class name defined in the stylesheet to use for the fallback test.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestProperty" /> and <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestValue" />,
            and either <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test-property
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The CSS property name to use for the fallback test.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestClass" /> and <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestValue" />,
            and either <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test-value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The CSS property value to use for the fallback test.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestClass" /> and <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackTestProperty" />,
            and either <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHref" /> or <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.LinkTagHelper.FallbackHrefInclude" />.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.OptionTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <option> elements.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            This <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> works in conjunction with <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.SelectTagHelper" />. It reads elements
            content but does not modify that content. The only modification it makes is to add a <c>selected</c> attribute
            in some cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: value
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Specifies a value for the <option> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            Renders a partial view.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name or path of the partial view that is rendered to the response.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model. Cannot be used together with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper.Model" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: model
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The model to pass into the partial view. Cannot be used together with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper.For" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: optional
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            When optional, executing the tag helper will no-op if the view cannot be located.
            Otherwise will throw stating the view could not be found.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: fallback-name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            View to lookup if the view specified by <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PartialTagHelper.Name" /> cannot be located.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: view-data
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ViewDataDictionary" /> to pass into the partial view.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PersistComponentStateTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            A <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.TagHelper" /> that saves the state of Razor components rendered on the page up to that point.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: persist-mode
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets or sets the <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.PersistComponentStateTagHelper.PersistenceMode" /> for the state to persist.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <script> elements that supports fallback src paths.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            The tag helper won't process for cases with just the 'src' attribute.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: src
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Address of the external script to use.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-src-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to load.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-src-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to exclude from loading.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper.SrcInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-src
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The URL of a Script tag to fallback to in the case the primary one fails.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-suppress-fallback-integrity
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Boolean value that determines if an integrity hash will be compared with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper.FallbackSrc" /> value.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-append-version
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Value indicating if file version should be appended to src urls.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            A query string "v" with the encoded content of the file is added.
            </remarks>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-src-include
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to fallback to in the case the
            primary one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-src-exclude
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A comma separated list of globbed file patterns of JavaScript scripts to exclude from the fallback list, in
            the case the primary one fails.
            The glob patterns are assessed relative to the application's 'webroot' setting.
            Must be used in conjunction with <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ScriptTagHelper.FallbackSrcInclude" />.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-fallback-test
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The script method defined in the primary script to use for the fallback test.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.SelectTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <select> elements with <c>asp-for</c> and/or
            <c>asp-items</c> attribute(s).
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-items
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            A collection of <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.SelectListItem" /> objects used to populate the <select> element with
            <optgroup> and <option> elements.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine whether <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.SelectTagHelper.For" /> is
            valid with an empty <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExpression.Name" />.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.TextAreaTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting <textarea> elements with an <c>asp-for</c> attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            An expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: name
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            The name of the <input> element.
            </summary>
            <remarks>
            Passed through to the generated HTML in all cases. Also used to determine whether <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.TextAreaTagHelper.For" /> is
            valid with an empty <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.ViewFeatures.ModelExpression.Name" />.
            </remarks>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ValidationMessageTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting any HTML element with an <c>asp-validation-for</c>
            attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-validation-for
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            Gets an expression to be evaluated against the current model.
            </summary>

TagHelpers.Name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ValidationSummaryTagHelper
TagHelpers.Documentation:
<summary>
            <see cref="T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Razor.TagHelpers.ITagHelper" /> implementation targeting any HTML element with an <c>asp-validation-summary</c>
            attribute.
            </summary>

BoundAttributes.Name: asp-validation-summary
BoundAttributes.Documentation:
<summary>
            If <see cref="F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ValidationSummary.All" /> or <see cref="F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ValidationSummary.ModelOnly" />, appends a validation
            summary. Otherwise (<see cref="F:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Rendering.ValidationSummary.None" />, the default), this tag helper does nothing.
            </summary>
            <exception cref="T:System.ArgumentException">
            Thrown if setter is called with an undefined <see cref="P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.TagHelpers.ValidationSummaryTagHelper.ValidationSummary" /> value e.g.
            <c>(ValidationSummary)23</c>.
            </exception>

TagHelpers.Name: Bind
TagHelpers.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributes.Name: @bind-...
BoundAttributes.Documentation: Binds the provided expression to an attribute and a change event, based on the naming of the bind attribute. For example: @bind-value="..." and @bind-value:event="onchange" will assign the current value of the expression to the 'value' attribute, and assign a delegate that attempts to set the value to the 'onchange' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: format
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies a format to convert the value specified by the corresponding bind attribute. For example: @bind-value:format="..." will apply a format string to the value specified in @bind-value="...". The format string can currently only be used with expressions of type DateTime.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: event
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the event handler name to attach for change notifications for the value provided by the '@bind-...' attribute.

BoundAttributeParameters.Name: culture
BoundAttributeParameters.Documentation: Specifies the culture to use for conversions.
